meanings.definition: Sail again in a different direction.
meanings.sent1: After reaching the shore, they decided to resail towards the sunset.
meanings.sent2: The captain chose to resail the ship towards the east.
meanings.sent3: The sailors were tired of resailing in circles and wanted a new adventure.
meanings.sent4: The idea to resail into the unknown filled them with excitement.
meanings.sent5: The decision to resail brought a sense of freedom and exploration.

meanings.definition: To sail back over the same course.
meanings.sent1: They had to resail the same path due to a navigation error.
meanings.sent2: The sailors resailed the route to retrieve a lost item.
meanings.sent3: Resailing the familiar waters felt like a nostalgic journey.
meanings.sent4: Resailing the same course was like retracing their steps in the sea.
meanings.sent5: The decision to resail brought back memories of their previous voyage.

meanings.sent1: The crew was excited to resail after a brief stop at the port.
meanings.sent2: They resailed the same route to enjoy the beautiful scenery once more.
meanings.sent3: Resailing under the starry sky felt like a magical experience.
meanings.sent4: Resailing the open sea was a chance to embrace the freedom of the waves.
meanings.sent5: The decision to resail was met with cheers and anticipation.
